pullRequest.body:
Shows that spaces modelled on locally path-connected spaces are themselves locally path-connected, and that the common model spaces `EuclideanHalfSpace n` and `EuclideanQuadrant n` are locally path-connected.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
- [x] depends on: #17064
- [x] depends on: #16983

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +65.24% | `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.ChartedSpace` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.ChartedSpace | 722 | 1193 | +471 (+65.24%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.Compactness.DeltaGeneratedSpace | 1709 | 1391 | -318 (-18.61%) |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.Topology | 1760 | 1681 | -79 (-4.49%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.Compactness.DeltaGeneratedSpace`|-318|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.Topology`|-79|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.UpperHalfPlane.FunctionsBoundedAtInfty`|-73|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.EisensteinSeries.UniformConvergence` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ModularForms.EisensteinSeries.IsBoundedAtImInfty`|-60|
| `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Sheaf.Basic`|455|
| `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.LocalInvariantProperties` `Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.ChartedSpace`|471|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ChartedSpace.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ Convex.locPathConnectedSpace`
`+ EuclideanHalfSpace.convex`
`+ EuclideanHalfSpace.pathConnectedSpace`
`+ EuclideanQuadrant.convex`
`+ EuclideanQuadrant.pathConnectedSpace`
`+ instance (priority := 100) LocallyConvexSpace.toLocPathConnectedSpace [Module ‚Ñù E]`
`+ instance : LocPathConnectedSpace (EuclideanQuadrant n)`
`+ instance [NeZero n] : LocPathConnectedSpace (EuclideanHalfSpace n)`
`+ pathComponentIn_mem_nhds`
`- instance (priority := 100) LocallyConvexSpace.toLocallyConnectedSpace [Module ‚Ñù E]`
`- instance (priority := 100) NormedSpace.instLocPathConnectedSpace : LocPathConnectedSpace E`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17064~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#16983~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

This should now be up-to-date and free of merge conflicts. There is one thing still left to decide though: should the two instances [LocallyConvexSpace.toLocallyConnectedSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/LocallyConvex.html#LocallyConvexSpace.toLocallyConnectedSpace) and [NormedSpace.instLocPathConnectedSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/Convex/Normed.html#NormedSpace.instLocPathConnectedSpace) that are made redundant by this PR be removed? I assume for `LocallyConvexSpace.toLocallyConnectedSpace` the answer is yes, since any file that imports it will also have access to [instLocallyConnectedSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Connected/PathConnected.html#instLocallyConnectedSpace) (which I realise now should probably be namespaced) and `LocallyConvexSpace.toLocPathConnectedSpace` from this PR. `NormedSpace.instLocPathConnectedSpace` is only made redundant by [NormedSpace.toLocallyConvexSpace](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Analysis/LocallyConvex/WithSeminorms.html#NormedSpace.toLocallyConvexSpace) though, which is a bit further up in the import graph; removing it might thus require adding more imports to a few files. I will try to push commits removing those two instances in a moment, and would appreciate feedback on whether those commits should be kept or undone.

Looks like there were actually no further import changes necessary - at least locally, mathlib still built just fine after removing both instances. I'm guessing local path-connectedness of normed spaces wasn't used much yet.

I think I was wrong about `Mathlib.Analysis.Convex.Normed` not importing `Mathlib.Analysis.LocallyConvex.WithSeminorms` - I don't know how to check transitive imports like that, and just looked through the direct imports without seeing any connection. Either way though, I think this PR should now be ready for review.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

bors r+
Thanks!

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12225426609/job/34099386179)

Merging failed because despite there being no merge conflict, a file introduced in another PR contained an import that became obsolete with this PR; hopefully the tests should pass now and the PR should be ready to merge.

Let's try again then
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12233343079/job/34120228552)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12233343079/job/34120229639)

Thanks for the quick response. This PR looks good to me, let's have a maintainer take a look.
maintainer merge?
There is a significant increase in imports to `ChartedSpace`. However, manifolds don't have many dependencies right now, so this might be ok --- or splitting that file could be a follow-up PR.
A couple of small comments. Thanks for the nice PR!

Thanks for the quick response. This PR looks good to me, let's have a maintainer take a look.
maintainer merge?
There is a significant increase in imports to `ChartedSpace`. However, manifolds don't have many dependencies right now, so this might be ok --- or splitting that file could be a follow-up PR.
Can you use named arguments instead of a sea of underscores? Something like `LocallyConvexSpace.convex_basis (\bbk := ‚Ñù) x.1` (untested)
Same as below: named arguments?
How about "if a charted space `M` admits at atlas ... then `M` itself is locally connected"?

The charted space structure *is* the atlas, right? So I think saying "a topological space" makes more sense. I did name the space `M` now though, and also fixed it to say locally path-connected instead of locally connected.

Well, a charted space might have several atlasses, one of which is connected, the other of which is not. (For local path-connectedness, that's probably all the same, though.)
I think the current phrasing is fine, though.
You're just using this once - inline into the proof?
Slightly tricky because lean couldn't infer the type `t ‚äÜ _` on its own, and annotating it directly pushed the line in question above the character limit - but I did manage to inline it now anyway.
Small trick: you can combine `use` and `refine` into `refine ‚ü®e.symm '' pathComponentIn (e x) (e '' t), ‚ü®?_, ?_‚ü©, subset_trans ?_ hts‚ü©`
Up to you if you want to inline `ht` also.
I think that would make the proof longer, so I'll keep it like this for now.
Pointing out for later reviewers: this is where the import increase is coming from.

```suggestion
lemma pathComponentIn_mem_nhds (hF : F ‚àà ùìù x) : pathComponentIn x F ‚àà nhds x := by
```
Can you use the notation for `nhds`, here and throughout the PR? Thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Geometry/Manifold): manifolds are locally path-connected
